009package imagingbook.common.image.matching;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * Instances of this class calculate an approximate distance transform of a given
016 * image which is assumed to be binary (pixel value 0 = background, non-zero = foreground).
017 * For the L2 norm, the resulting distances are only an approximation.
018 * See Sec. 23.2.2 (Alg. 23.2) of [1] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
022 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2014-04-20
027 * @version 2022/09/16 revised
028 */
029public class DistanceTransform {
030        
031        private final float[][] D;
032        
033        /**
034         * Constructor using the default distance norm (L2).
035         * @param I the input image
036         */
037        public DistanceTransform(ImageProcessor I) {
038                 this(I, DistanceNorm.L2);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor using the specified distance norm.
043         * @param I the input image
044         * @param norm the distance norm
045         */
046        public DistanceTransform(ImageProcessor I, DistanceNorm norm) {
047                D = makeDistanceMap(I, norm);
048        }
049        
050        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
051        
052        private float[][] makeDistanceMap(ImageProcessor I, DistanceNorm norm) {
053                float m1, m2;
054                switch (norm) {
055                case L1:
056                        m1 = 1; m2 = 2; break;
057                case L2:
058                        m1 = 1; m2 = (float) Math.sqrt(2); break;
059                default:
060                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unhandled norm " + norm);
061                }
062                
063                final int M = I.getWidth();
064                final int N = I.getHeight();
065                final float[][] D = new float[M][N];
066                float d0, d1, d2, d3;
067
068                // L->R pass:
069                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
070                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
071                                if (I.get(u, v) > 0) {          // a foreground pixel
072                                        D[u][v] = 0;
073                                }
074                                else {                                          // a background pixel
075                                        d0 = d1 = d2 = d3 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
076                                        if (u > 0) {
077                                                d0 = m1 + D[u - 1][v];
078                                                if (v > 0)      {
079                                                        d1 = m2 + D[u - 1][v - 1];
080                                                }
081                                        }
082                                        if (v > 0) {
083                                                d2 = m1 + D[u][v - 1];
084                                                if (u < M - 1) {
085                                                        d3 = m2 + D[u + 1][v - 1];
086                                                }
087                                        }
088                                        D[u][v] = min(d0, d1, d2, d3);  
089                                }
090                        }
091                }
092                
093                // R->L pass:
094                for (int v = N - 1; v >= 0; v--) {
095                        for (int u = M - 1; u >= 0; u--) {
096                                if (D[u][v] > 0) {      // a background pixel
097                                        d0 = d1 = d2 = d3 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
098                                        if (u < M - 1)  {
099                                                d0 = m1 + D[u + 1][v];
100                                                if (v < N - 1) {
101                                                        d1 = m2 + D[u + 1][v + 1];
102                                                }
103                                        }
104                                        if (v < N - 1) {
105                                                d2 = m1 + D[u][v + 1];
106                                                if (u > 0) {
107                                                        d3 = m2 + D[u - 1][v + 1];
108                                                }
109                                        }
110                                        D[u][v] = min(D[u][v], d0, d1, d2, d3);
111                                }
112                        }
113                }
114                return D;
115        }
116        
117        private float min(float... a) {
118                float minVal = a[0];
119                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
120                        if (a[i] < minVal) 
121                                minVal = a[i];
122                }
123                return minVal;
124        }
125        
126        public float[][] getDistanceMap() {
127                return D;
128        }
129        
130
131}
